248195.en:
I often walk around this corridor because my body gets tired from being cooped up in the castle! It's good
exercise!

248196.en:
I haven't seen you around here before!
You must be a Madesagora art lover to
come all the way here!<yesno><break>

248197.en:
No, you didn't! You have a thick skin to come to this country without understanding the art of Madesagora,
don't you? Well, I have no skin on my face, let alone on my entire body! Kaka!

248198.en:
Boo hoo! I moved to this country because of my love for Madesagora art! I was so in love with Madesagora's art
that I moved to this country! However, although everyone says that the dazzling motifs of delusion and
innocence depicted relentlessly in ''Visions'' and ''Partos'' after his accession to the throne are the
ultimate in late Magic Demonism, I think that his paranoid envy of the Creator was secretly manifested in the
technique of ultra-darkness in ''The Thunder Burying'' before the accession to the throne of the Great Demon King.
I think that his paranoid envy of the Creator was secretly manifested in the techniques of super-darkness. Don't
you think so, too?

248199.en:
What? You are quite a young man with a lot of backbone to speak out against my opinion! Well, I have almost
nothing but bones! Kaka!

248200.en:
You think so, too? Chimi! You have
good eyes to see, don't you? I don't
have the eyes to see it! Kaka kaka!

248201.en:
Madesagora was an exceptional person who had not only the talent of a Great Demon King, but also the genius of an
artist. That is why the people of this country love the art of Madesagora's legacy.

248202.en:
When I heard that Madesagora had lost, I was very surprised. Everyone in this country was saddened. But it is a fact
of the Demon World that those who win the struggle stay alive and those who lose die. Everyone accepts that it
can't be helped.
248202.ja:

248203.en:
This is the throne room where
Madesagora once resided. Now, the
Elder Nubro is in charge of it.

248204.en:
I am under orders from Marshal Zeldrad to guard this place, and even though Zeldrad is gone, this is still my
post.

248205.en:
I want to play outside... I'm tired of
being inside my backside...

248206.en:
I'm amazed you guys made it this far. Even though the outside of the castle is filled with demon miasma, which is
a harsh poison even for us monsters. I'm sure it's only because of the blessings of the maiden of miasma. I'm
looking forward to seeing your miko activities.

248208.en:
As for Demon King Mark, we will keep looking for him. We will let you know if we learn anything. Please rest in
your room. Please rest in your room.

248209.en:
We have suffered from demon miasma for a long time. We believe that the priestess will save us from demon
miasma!

248210.en:
This man tried to get out of the palace and out of Gora, but he came back with demon miasma on the way. I
want to get out of Gora too, but seeing someone fail like this diminishes my courage.

248211.en:
Oh my God, Pepero-sama, you are so rude! He paints graffiti everywhere in the palace! The other day, he drew a
postcard on my slender body! I couldn't get rid of it for a while, I was so mad!

248212.en:
Outside, there is a strange structure with a winding road. It is not only Madesagora's work, but also a public
vehicle. It is the result of Madesagora's extraordinary talent to be able to create such a mysterious
thing. We have lost a very dear friend, Belon. Oh yes, it is rumored that there is a secret mechanism
hidden somewhere in this palace that Madesagora also created, Belon.

248213.en:
We can hardly go outside the palace. That's why we fly a Famililar called Evil Eye to see what's going on in the
outside world.

248214.en:
It may have fallen into decline, but when Madesagora was alive and well, this country was one of the most
powerful in the Demon World. The four demon generals, including Zeldrad, the renowned hero of the time, were all
lined up in Gora, and the most powerful people of the time were all gathered there. Looking back on it
now, I realize that it was only because of Madesagora's charisma that he was able to unite such powerful
men.
248214.ja:

248215.en:
Recently, the demon miasma outside has been increasing. Is it because the Age of Miasma is finally approaching, or
is there another reason? If demon miasma continues to increase at this rate, the castle's wards will
eventually break down. If that happens, we're all finished!

248216.en:
Hey, I heard that there will be no more sesame trees since the goddess has come! Then we'll be able to play
outside, won't we?

248217.en:
This is parlor. The priestess is resting now. must be tired after a long journey. I will
look into Demon King Mark, so please rest here.

248219.en:
<attr><feel_think_one><end_attr>Mr. Pepero says this picture means his
signature, but to me it looks more
like a postcard.<bw_break>

248220.en:
<attr><feel_sad_lv1><end_attr>What a shame. I wish he would do the
same to us.

248221.en:
I heard that Madesagora-sama was working on a tremendous work that shook the world of art in his studio
before he left for Astoltia. I heard that he disappeared into the darkness without being exhibited due to the
outbreak of demon miasma, but I would like to see his work at first sight.

248222.en:
Gora was originally a small town in the middle of nowhere, but after Madesagora-sama became the Great Demon
King, Gora suddenly became the capital of the Demon World. However, after Madesagora's departure for war, a
great outpouring of demon miasma occurred, and now there is no sign of its former glory.

248223.en:
This is the Demon Palace, where the Great Demon King Madesagora used to reside until his departure for
Astoltia. Currently, we, the people of Gora, are living in seclusion, escaping from demon miasma. The room
where Irusha-sama went to is on your right after going up the great staircase.

248224.en:
Oh, the escort of Master Irusha.
<pc>, wasn't it? I hope you
had a good rest.<yesno><break>

248225.en: I see. Well, that's too bad.<bw_break>

248226.en:
Thank you for your kind words. It was
the best room we could offer.<bw_break>

248227.en:
Well, we have gathered some information about the Demon King Mark that you asked about, and we have a
clue. After becoming the Great Demon King, Madesagora went back to her own studio to devote herself to the
creation of an artwork. It seems that Madesagora left Demon King Mark at his studio and went to Astoltia. Soon
after, demon miasma erupted and the studio sank to the bottom of the demon miasma. Thus, Demon King Mark was
lost. Along with a phantom masterpiece that Madesagora-sama had produced. The studio is located in a place called
Demon Park Madessaince in the lower level of Gora. It is sunk in the deep demon miasma and is normally
inaccessible. But if you are Irusha, you will be able to clear the deep demon miasma. Then you will be able to
reach the studio.

248228.en:
Good morning. Mr. Nubro is waiting for you in the throne room. The throne room is at the back of the palace,
down the stairs.

248230.en:
This is the Demon Palace, where the Great Demon King Madesagora used to reside until his departure for
Astoltia. Currently, we, the people of Gora, are living in seclusion, escaping from demon miasma.

248231.en:
Boo hoo chimey! I hear you're headed to Demon Park Madessaince! I'm so jealous! I'm envious! But even I can't
keep my sanity in that place covered in deep demon miasma, and you've got some nerve going there! As a lover of
the Madesagora arts, I'd like to join you, but it's going to be difficult since I don't even have a sitz liver
anymore! Kaka kaka!

248232.en:
Demon Park Madessaince is a playful labyrinthine Utopia built by Madesagora. Demon Park itself is a
work of art. Once the people used to come here to appreciate the art, but since it sank into demon miasma, no
one should have set foot in it. Please be careful.

248233.en:
To get to the Demon King Mark, you will need to take the ''Coffin to the Abyss'' ride down to the lower level.
You can reach it by leaving the palace and following the road to the west. I would appreciate it if you could
investigate the demon miasma outburst as well, while you are at Demon King Mark's. Please be careful.

248234.en:
I understand that you are heading to Demon Park Madessaince. I heard that Madesagora has many tricks up her
sleeve for your amusement.

248235.en: Evil Eye is flapping its wings.

248236.en:
Boo hoo chimi! I heard you went to Madesagora's studio! I'm so jealous! I'm jealous! That place is sacred
ground for lovers of the Madesagora arts! It's Utopia! I would like to go there once before I die! But I've been
dead for a long time now! Kaka!

248237.en:
Thanks to you, this country will not
perish for now. Thank you very much.

248238.en:
Someday, when the weather clears up, I
want to play outside with all my
might.

248239.en:
Oh, maiden of miasma. You guys are the
best! Thank you so much!

248241.en:
Thanks to the work of , we were able to calm the deep demon miasma that covered Gora. Thank you
very much for your help. It seems that Pepero is in his room contemplating his next work. Please visit him if you
would like.

248242.en:
Hmmm... this is the picture in which Pepero-sama completed Madesagora- sama's fantastic masterpiece. It is as
if Pepelo has reproduced Madesagora's grand vision with his bold interpretation and ruined it. Come to
think of it, Irusha-sama was invited by Pepero-sama, wasn't she? Pepero's private room is just up the stairs on
the left side of this picture.

248243.en:
This man tried to get out of this palace and out of Ghora, but on the way he was affected by demon miasma
and came back. He had been suffering from demon miasma for a long time, but now that Lord Irusha has rid him of
it, he seems to be able to sleep soundly.
248243.ja:

248244.en:
I don't like the way you've become even more confident than before! And you're getting friendly with the
priestess. She's attractive, but my slender, twisted body is no match for her!

248245.en:
The increase in the number of demon miasma in the area was caused by a guy named Jaomanda. What is the monster
that produces demon miasma?

248246.en:
<attr><feel_happy_lv3><end_attr>I heard that Miko has removed the
outside mats! I wonder if we can play
outside in a while!

248247.en:
Thank you so much for getting rid of
the cause of demon miasma!

248248.en:
Peperogora's dragon paintings are on
display.

248250.en:
The priestess liked this picture, but if you ask me, I think there is something shiny about it, but still,
it is a strange picture. Hmmm, it is difficult to evaluate. I guess I'll reserve judgment until Pepero-sama's
next work.

248251.en:
According to rumors, Mr. Madesagora's great work was an ambitious attempt to depict the struggle of life. It may
have been Madesagora's life-long theme to depict the state of life struggling to survive.

248252.en:
Thanks to the work of these priestesses, I have hope for the future of this country. Thank you very
much!

248253.en:
<attr><feel_happy_lv2><end_attr>I am relieved that demon miasma seems
to have cleared up. <pc>
Thank you very much Irusha!

248254.en:
I don't know much about GEJETSU, but I can feel the passion in the pictures that Mr. Pepero draws. I don't dislike
it.

248255.en:
Gora was originally a small town in the middle of nowhere, but after Madesagora became the Great Demon
King, it quickly became the capital of the Demon World. After the demon miasma erupted and destroyed the city,
the country barely survived, but thanks to the priestesses, hope was restored.

248256.en:
Welcome to Demon Palace . This palace was the residence of Lord Madesagora until his departure for
Astoltia. Now we, the people of Gora, are living in seclusion after escaping from demon miasma.

250377.en:
Noooo. I can't find it no matter where I look. Did I drop it at that time after all? I want to forget it, but I
can't. It's so beautiful, so hateful. Without it, I...

250378.en:
Hmph. I am the Minister of Arts and Sciences of the Demon Palace. To put it simply, I am in charge of the
management and restoration of the palace's artifacts.

250379.en:
Noooo. I can't find it no matter where I look. Did I drop it at that time after all? I want to forget it, but I
can't. It's so beautiful, so hateful. Without it, I...

250380.en:
You there. Yes, you. You're in the right place. I'm just an old man named Nugio. The truth is, I've accidentally
lost my most prized possession. Can you help me find it?

250381.en:
Oh, thank God! Normally, no one would listen to a son of a bitch like him. But what did I ask him to do? What did
I ask for? Oh, I'm kidding. What I want you to look for is my badge. I always carry it with me, but I must
have dropped it in my haste when I was evacuating the palace. I don't remember where exactly. I think it was
southwest of Phantom City Gora. I'm having trouble remembering. For the time being, I would like you to look
for it in the southwest of Phantom City Gora. I'm counting on you.

250382.en:
Thank you. Huh? You accept too many requests. Are you the type that doesn't say no when you're asked to do
something? Your reaction was right on target, wasn't it? Well, come back when you're free. I'm out.
250382.ja:
ã€Œã‚ã‚ŠãŒãŸã„ã®ã†ã€‚ ã€€â€¦â€¦ã¬ï¼Ÿã€€ãŠã¬ã—ã€€é ¼ã¾ã‚Œã”ã¨ã‚’ ã€€å¼•ãå—ã‘ã™ãã¦ã„ã‚‹ã®ã†ã€‚

250383.en:
You are a very good and honorable man, refusing to do what the poor son of a bitch asked you to do! Well, help me
if you feel like it.

250384.en:
Hmph. I am the Minister of Arts and Sciences of the Demon Palace. To put it simply, I'm in charge of the
management and restoration of the palace's artifacts. Peperogoraboy is a pain in the ass. He is always trying
to make a rough sketch of the great Madesagora's works of art.

250385.en:
Without it, I feel as if the contents of my eagle are spilling out and disappearing. I feel like I'm losing
who I am.

250386.en:
Oh, no, I think my treasure badge has fallen southwest of Phantom City Gora. I think my treasure badge may have
fallen southwest of Phantom City Gora.

250387.en: Oh, no! Did you find my badge?

250388.en:
Would you like to give Nuggio a Dirty
Badge?<yesno><case 1><break><case 2><close><case_cancel><close><case_end>

250389.en:
Oops, I guess I jumped the gun. Keep
up the good work.

250391.en:
This is definitely my badge, however. But... my head! What a horrible beauty. I'm humiliated like this
because of him. If only he weren't here.

250392.en:
It is completely soiled. It's been a long time since I lost it. Hmm? You look so silly. Is there something on
my face? He's a funny guy. Now, if only I could somehow restore this badge to its former beauty. Yes. Maybe
Gemelde, the Minister of Arts and Sciences, can do something about it. Take the badge to her. Gemelde should
be in the east corridor of this level. I'm sorry, but I'm going to have to ask you to do it.
250392.ja:

250393.en:
Dirty Badge (Key Item) was entrusted
to me by Nugio!<me 60><bw_break>

250394.en:
Ask Gemelde in the east corridor on
the first floor to give you a badge of
honor.

250395.en:
He took everything from me. I have
nothing left.

250396.en:
<icon_exc><turn_pc>Oh, no. Take my badge to Gemelde, the
Minister of Arts and Sciences.<open_irai><bw_break>

250397.en:
Gemelde should be in the east corridor
of this level. I'm sorry, but I'm
going to need your help.

250398.en:
Peperogoraboy has done another graffiti on a work of art in the palace, so I'm on my way to Krinneung
now. Oh? Gemelde, the Minister of Arts and Sciences, is none other than myself. What can I do for you?

250399.en:
Would you like to give Gemelde a Dirty
Badge?<yesno><case 1><break><case 2><close><case_cancel><close><case_end>

250400.en:
Is that so? I don't think it's good for your mental health to hold back what you want to say. Well, have it
your way.

250402.en:
Oh? Well, well, well? It's deteriorated considerably. No way! I see. You want the Krinneng of this
work, I see. In that case, I'll take it. When it comes to rinneung art, there is no one in the Demon World
better than me. Let's get to work right away.

250403.en:
Gemelde used a number of unknown liquids to lift off the grime and then carefully cleaned the badge. The badge
began to glow with beauty!

250404.en:
As expected of me. It's shining! However, some letters that were carved on it have been chipped off. It was
made a long time ago, and I can't recall what the letters were that were carved here. Yes, that's right! There
must have been a catalogue of this work in the inn on the southeast side of the second floor. Find it and look
up the characters. When you find the letters, please tell me in a loud voice. Is that clear? Loudly, you
mean?

250405.en:
Find the catalogue on the 2nd floor, southeast of the inn, look up the letters on the badge and report it to
Gemelde via ''Nearby'' in the chat room.

250406.en:
Shit! Why, I can't do it! Why can't I
do it? If only I was half as talented
as he is!

250407.en:
<icon_exc><turn_pc>Oh, no. The words engraved on your
badge? Let me see...<open_irai><bw_break>

250408.en:
How could I remember? Because I'm an old man. Oh-ho-ho. Why don't you look for the catalogue as Gemelde
suggested? Well, well, what kind of catalogue is it?
250408.ja:
ã€Œè¦šãˆã¦ã‚‹ã‚ã‘ãªã„ã®ã†ã€‚ ã€€ã ã£ã¦ã€€ãƒ¯ã‚·ã€€å¹´å¯„ã‚Šã˜ã‚ƒã‚‚ã‚“ã€‚ ã€€ã»ã£ã»ã£ã»ã€‚

250409.en:
Please look for a catalogue with the same artwork as this badge in the inn on the southeast side of the second
floor. You will probably find it on a bookshelf. If you look up the letters, please tell me in a loud voice. Okay?
Loudly, you mean?

250410.en:
Find the catalogue on the 2nd floor, southeast of the inn, look up the letters on the badge and report it to
Gemelde via ''Nearby'' in the chat room.

250411.en:
The catalogue is entitled ''The Art of Madesagora''.It introduces works that leave a vivid impression, such as
''False Dreams,'' ''Partos,'' ''The Thunder Burying,'' ''The Fetters of the Golden Beetle,'' and ''The Sorrow of Breakfast.
Among them, there was a work that seemed to be the same as Nugio's badge. I read more about
.

250412.en:
The Eyes of Chaos, also known as Madessaince Badge, is one of a series of smaller works by the rare genius
Madesagora after his ascension to the throne of the Great Demon King. Madesagora says it represents the soul
of a saint trapped in hell, gazing into the future of the Demon World. This work is inscribed with
Madesagora's famous words, ''Art is Madessence.

250413.en:
Now that we know the inscription on
the badge, we can report it to Gemelde
in the ''Nearby'' chat room.

250414.en:
Sagola. Why are you here? Without you,
I wouldn't be here.

250415.en: <icon_exc><turn_pc>Oh, no. My head feels a little fuzzy.<open_irai><bw_break>

250416.en:
What happened to my badge? I'm sure Gemelde, the Minister of Arts and Sciences, will be able to restore it.
I'm counting on you.

250417.en:
Well, from the looks of it, it looks like you found the catalogue. Now, please let me know what letters you
found. Please make a lot of noise in the ''Nearby'' chat room! Don't be shy.
250417.ja:

250418.en:
The art of the arts is madessence! I see! These words are full of confidence, just like her! What? Why
did you make me shout it out loud? Because it seemed somehow interesting. Is that bad? I don't care about that,
so I'll get started on the restoration. Please wait a little.
250418.ja:

250419.en:
Gemelde took out his favorite tools one after another and set to work on the restoration with a true sword
face. And then..!

250420.en:
I'm all set. Here you go, Madesagora-
sama's masterpiece has been revived.

250422.en:
How dazzlingly beautiful. As expected of the one and only genius, Madesagora. His presence is
overwhelming. He is truly a revolutionary of Demon World art! He wiped out the conservative influences
of the Nugio school at the same time as his debut. Nugio was the representative artist of Demon World,
but Madesagora's revolution has completely captivated and dominated the hearts of the people. Few people
remember Nugio now. His art has such immense power.

250423.en: Let's give Madessaince Badge to Nugio.

250425.en:
<icon_exc><turn_pc>Oh, no. What happened to my badge? Did
you get it back?

250426.en:
Would you give Nugio the Madessaince
Badge?<yesno><case 1><break><case 2><close><case_cancel><close><case_end>

250427.en:
Oops, I guess I jumped the gun. Keep
up the good work.

250429.en:
Ah, as I thought. We meet again at last. My eternal hatred, Madesagora. I was once a much-admired artist and
genius in this land. Until Madesagora showed up. The whole Demon World was captivated by the emergence of a true
genius, and no one would look at the work of an ordinary man anymore. Deprived of fame, I envied and hated
him. But unfortunately, I was also captivated by his art and became preoccupied with it. Even with the pen
in my hand, nothing came to mind. Eventually, I was forgotten by the world, and I stopped painting. The
glory, the dreams, the longing, all vanished, and only this work secretly received remained. Oh-ho-ho. Thank you
for finding my one and only treasure. This is my way of saying thank you.

250430.en:
Is art a madessance? A word that is very like him. Madesagora is dead. But his art will live on forever,
dominating my mind. I might have been happier to forget him, but there's no escaping it. It's cruel.

He is truly a revolutionary in the art of Demon World! He wiped out the influences of the conservative Nugio
school upon his debut. Nugio was the leading artist of the Demon World, but Madesagora's revolution has completely
captivated and dominated the hearts and minds of the people. Few people remember Nugio now. His art has such
immense power.

250432.en:
Madesagora is dead. But his art will live on and dominate my mind forever. I might have been happier to forget
him, but there's no escaping it. It's cruel.

250433.en:
Peperogoraboy's work is still crude and immature, but as an artist, I think there are things that shine
through. However, I do not condone the use of any unsolicited postcards on Madesagora's work! I will give you a
lecture later!

250434.en:
The catalogue is entitled ''The Art of Madesagora''.The catalogue introduces works that leave a vivid impression,
such as ''False Dreams,'' ''Partos,'' ''The Thunder Burying,'' ''The Fetal Movement of the Golden Beetle,'' and ''The
Sadness of Breakfast. Among them, there was one work that gave off a striking aura of glamour. Please read
more about it in .

250995.en:
<pc> remembered that Irusha
had been summoned by Peperogora, so
let's go to Peperogora's private room.

253985.en:
It is one of the representative works of the period after the accession of the Great Demon King, which is called
the golden age of Madesagora. The technique of this work belongs to the hyper-darkness school. The depiction
of the crown is often mistaken for a self-portrait, but Madesagora himself explicitly denies this. Like other
works, the motif of this work is envy of the Creator, but the Great Demon King left for Astoltia without
confirming or denying the motif.

253986.en:
*In the sequence, instead of displaying the standard farewell line (Thank you!) is not displayed, but
instead the following text is displayed Thank you very much!By the way, you have a visitor. By the way,
my dear customers, I have an unexpected favor to ask of you.(Note for book creators) Fixed line

253987.en:
Too bad.I look forward to seeing you
again!Fixed lines

253988.en:
Wow, I'm so happy! I'm asking for a favor regarding the new letterhead we're about to launch here at the Post
Office.The most famous person in Gora is the former Great Demon King and the great artist Madesagora! This country
is the cradle of Madesagora art. *(Notes for Book Creator) Write freely according to the content of your
quest.So there! I was wondering if it would be possible to use one of Madesagora's paintings, which are
still highly valued even after her death, as a letterpress. (Note for book creators: Write freely according
to the content of the quest.However, the bold and delicate colors of Madesagora's art cannot be reproduced
with ordinary paints! (Note for book creators) Write freely according to the content of your quest.The deep
blacks are particularly difficult to reproduce, but it seems that Madesagora mixed a special liquid
called Tears of Grief into her paints. (Note for book creators: Feel free to write freely according to the content
of your quest.Tears of Grief can be found in Phantom City Gora and other places, and is sometimes dropped when
a monster named <%sev_que_name0> is defeated. (Note for book creators: Feel free to write in any way you
like, depending on the content of the quest.So, please, could you go and get Tears of Grief? Of course, I'll give
you a warning when I'm done!(Note for book creators) Only the item name is changed. You can change it if
necessary.

pages, but it would be ideal to explain only the details of the request, and every line should be
accompanied by a request form display.

253999.en:
Phew! It's amazing! It's a masterpiece!Here you go. The Magical City of Gorla, limited edition, local

254000.en:
Anger, suffering, sadness. The complex, deep black color is called ''madesa black.'' It is as if a variety
of emotions have been melted into it. A word of omake: write one or two words of your choice, such as a
comment about the Paper Shop setting, local letterhead, etc.I am one of those who love Madesagora art. I
really wanted to reproduce this black. Thank you so much! (Note for book creators: write one or two words of
your choice, such as a comment about the Paper Shop setting, a local letterhead, etc.Phantom City Paper
will be sold exclusively at the Post Office as soon as possible! We look forward to seeing you again.(Note for

254264.en:
Hmmm... this is the picture in which Pepero-sama completed Madesagora- sama's fantastic masterpiece. It seems
as if Pepero has reproduced Madesagora's grand vision with his bold interpretation, or perhaps he has
ruined it.

254265.en:
I'm already working on a grand new project. I intend to create my own masterpiece that will make everyone's
eyes widen in wonder! And eventually, I will surpass Madesagora's old man and become the greatest artist in the
Demon World! I'm indebted to you all. I'll help you with anything related to art, so let me know if there's
anything I can do! Hahahaha!
